title: Angus Talbot
text:
Robert Neville (Angus) Talbot is an Australian <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a> and <a href="barrister">barrister</a>. He is a <a href="retired">retired</a> <a href="Judge">Judge</a> of the <a href="Land%20and%20Environment%20Court%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">Land and Environment Court of New South Wales</a> and the immediate past <a href="Chairman">Chairman</a> of the Executive Committee of the Council of <a href="Newington%20College">Newington College</a>.
Early life.
Christened Robert Neville, Talbot has always been known by the name Angus. He was educated at <a href="Newington%20College">Newington College</a> (1949–1953) and graduated in <a href="law">law</a> from the <a href="University%20of%20Sydney">University of Sydney</a>.
Legal career.
After practising as a solicitor and partner with Fitzgerald White Talbot & Co from 1960 to 1982, Talbot was admitted to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a> <a href="bar%20association">Bar</a> in 1982. He was appointed to the <a href="Land%20and%20Environment%20Court%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">Land and Environment Court of New South Wales</a> bench in 1992 and retired as a Judge in 2007.
